thread.title: US stocks dip on Chinese data
thread.title_full: US stocks dip on Chinese data | Business Spectator

author: AFP
title: US stocks dip on Chinese data
text:
US stocks have opened lower as a big decline in Chinese industrial profits offset news of Alcoa's corporate split and a big merger between energy pipeline companies.
Five minutes into trade on Monday, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was at 16,181.61, down 133.06 points (0.82 per cent).
The broad-based S&P 500 fell 16.86 (0.87 per cent) to 1,914.48, while the tech-rich Nasdaq Composite Index dropped 42.54 (0.91 per cent) to 4,643.96.
Profits at a range of large Chinese industrial companies declined by almost nine per cent last month compared with the same period in 2014, the country's statistics office said. That marked the biggest drop in four years.
Aluminum company Alcoa rose 2.4 per cent after announcing it would split into two companies. Energy Transfer Equity will acquire the Williams Companies for about $US37.7 billion, to create a giant in US oil and gas pipelines, the companies announced.
